name: Gambia
description: The Gambia, officially the Republic of The Gambia, is a country in West Africa. Bordering Senegal to the north and east, and sharing a short coastline with the Atlantic Ocean to the west, it's a small nation known for its diverse ecosystems, rich cultural heritage, and role as a key migratory route for birds.  It’s a nation striving to balance economic development with environmental conservation.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The nation's capital and largest city, situated on a peninsula.
quickFacts.detail: Banjul is a vibrant port city with a unique blend of colonial architecture and bustling markets.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of The Gambia is predominantly young.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 60% of the population is under the age of 25.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small country with diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: It's one of the smallest countries in Africa.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The official language of The Gambia.
quickFacts.detail: It was adopted during British colonial rule and remains the language of government and education.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Primarily driven by agriculture and services.

quickFacts.label: Independence
quickFacts.description: Gained independence from the United Kingdom.

climateData.title: Climate
climateData.description: The Gambia experiences a tropical savanna climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The coastal areas are humid, while inland regions are drier.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A period of low rainfall and high temperatures. The landscape turns golden brown.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Heavy rainfall and increased humidity. Rivers swell, and vegetation flourishes.

naturalWonders.name: The Banc D'Arguin National Park
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this park protects a vital nesting ground for seabirds and a crucial stopover for migratory birds along the Atlantic coast. It’s a haven for marine life and a critical part of the African coastline.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a vast area of sand dunes, lagoons, and offshore islands. It’s a biodiversity hotspot and a significant area for conservation efforts.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for navigation

naturalWonders.name: Karenga Hills
naturalWonders.description: A series of ancient hills offering panoramic views and a glimpse into the region's geological history. These hills are a testament to the forces that shaped the landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Karenga Hills are composed of Precambrian sandstone and shale, dating back over 1.8 billion years. They are a significant geological feature and a popular destination for hiking and photography.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of The Gambia
ecosystemData.overview: The Gambia boasts a remarkable diversity of ecosystems, ranging from mangrove forests and coastal wetlands to savanna grasslands and freshwater lakes. These ecosystems support a rich array of flora and fauna.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: These coastal forests provide vital habitat for fish, birds, and other wildlife, and play a crucial role in protecting the coastline from erosion.

statistics.details: Covering a significant portion of the coastline

biodiversityCategories.name: Savanna Grasslands
biodiversityCategories.description: Vast expanses of grasslands support a diverse range of herbivores and predators, forming the backbone of the country's ecosystem.

statistics.details: Various grass species and grazing animals

activities.title: Activities in The Gambia
activities.description: The Gambia offers a wide range of activities for visitors, from wildlife viewing and birdwatching to cultural experiences and water sports.

activityCategories.name: Wildlife & Birdwatching
activityCategories.description: Explore the country's diverse wildlife and birdlife in national parks and reserves.

activities.name: Safari
activities.description: Guided tours to observe wildlife in their natural habitat.
safety: Maintain a safe distance from animals

activities.name: Birdwatching Tour
activities.description: Guided tours to spot various bird species.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities along the coast and in the rivers.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and mangrove forests by kayak.

activities.name: Fishing
activities.description: Traditional fishing trips with local fishermen.

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle
